Recent updates in NYC include a phony real estate scam costing renters $25K, a significant drop in summer crime rates, and the indictment of a Manhattan building owner for tenant harassment, alongside ongoing discussions about affordable housing investments and public safety measures amid a mayoral race.

### Emergencies & Risks

Multiple incidents in New York City highlight ongoing safety concerns, including a stabbing on public transit and a building explosion.

- Phony real estate agent scammed would-be renters out of $25K, according to Manhattan DA. ### Transportation

NYC transportation landscape is set for significant changes with fare increases and ongoing robotaxi testing.

- MTA fares and tolls are scheduled to increase in 2026, impacting commuters. [Read](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Waymo has received approval to continue testing its robotaxis in NYC until the end of 2025. - The NYC running boom is contributing nearly $1 billion to the local economy, showcasing the sport's growing popularity.
